title: Synthetic cannabinoids
summary: Synthetic cannabinoids are a class of designer drug molecules that bind to the same receptors to which cannabinoids (THC and CBD) in cannabis plants attach.[1] These novel psychoactive substances should not be confounded with synthetic phytocannabinoids (THC or CBD obtained by chemical synthesis) or synthetic endocannabinoids from which they are in many aspects distinct.[2][3][4]
